page.title: 07RHYMNEY VALLEY LANDSCAPE
page.content: The town of Rhymney is situated at the top end of the Rhymney Valley, through which the Rhymney River flows. The Valley itself is shaped rather like a marrow bone, with the town of Rhymney situated in the wide part at the head of the valley.Between the top and the bottom of the valley, the houses are built on the sides of the mountains which are rather steep in parts.This has, in effect, produced a landscape of{ribbon development,}with long rows of terraced housing.This is in complete contrast to the rather more flattened effect of Rhymney Town. The River Rhymney eventually flows into the Bristol Channel at Rumney, Cardiff, having flowed through one of the most industrial valleys of South Wales.
